titleStmt.title: W. S. Thompson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency, Governor Thos E Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We, your petitioners would represent, to your Excellency, that at the May term (1864) of the Owsley Circuit Court, McKinley Malory was fined, $60.00 for tippling, the offense was charged to have been committed some five or six years since,

We would further represent that Mr Malony is a poor man and a law abiding citizen, and it ^would^ greatly distress him and his family to have the fine to pay. We would therefore humbly ask you to extend your Executive clemency and remit so much of the fine as is due the Commonwealth of Kentucky, and in duty bound will every pray.

W. S. Thompson, Esqr
E. G. Creech
B. T. Spencer
A Thompson
John Megurne
Daniel B Maloney
